name: shallot
readme:
# Shallot
Shallot is a HTTP DSL based on coffeescript. It is very similar to
[zappa](https://github.com/mauricemach/zappa)
but tries to be more lightweight.

## Installation

```plaintext
npm install shallot
```

## Usage

Probably the shortest example possible

```coffeescript
require('shallot') -> @get -> 'Hello World!'
```

### No seriously
Shallot does not depend on express. It rather is up to you which kind
of middlewares you want to use and what kind of rendering engine you require.
It uses
[copperhead](https://github.com/niclashoyer/copperhead)
as router.

```coffeescript
connect = require 'connect'

require('shallot') ->

	@use connect.static 'public'

	@get ->
		'Hello World!'

	@get '/:name', ->
		"Hello #{@name}!"
```

## More
More features may be added in the future. The main goal is to achieve the most
powerful HTTP server functionality with minimal lines of code.
